title: Jeff Bezos and the secretive world of superyachts
description: The world's richest man will reportedly set sail next month on one of the largest superyachts ever built.

title: 'We cannot sleep': Mothers caught in the Israel-Gaza conflict
description: Mothers in Israel and Gaza tell the BBC they are terrified for their families as fighting escalates.

title: Erling Haaland and Jadon Sancho braces win German Cup for Dortmund
description: Two goals each from Jadon Sancho and Erling Braut Haaland give Borussia Dortmund a 4-1 win over RB Leipzig in the German Cup final.

title: WCMX: The backflipping wheelchair star helping others
description: The first Australian to land a wheelchair backflip shares his skills to help others overcome obstacles.

title: Why was Mane 'angry' and is Alexander-Arnold a Euros certainty?
description: Amid fan protests and a crucial three points for Liverpool, there were plenty of other talking points at Old Trafford on Thursday.

title: Building's hard problem - making concrete green
description: Concrete accounts for 8% of carbon dioxide emissions, but some firms are hoping to cut that down.

title: Covid crisis grips crowded Kolkata
description: Kolkata, one of the most densely-populated cities in India, hasn't escaped the Covid-19 surge.

title: Friends reunion premiere date and celebrity guests announced
description: The much-anticipated special will see the original cast and celebrities reflect on the series.

title: Victim of 'Elon Musk' Bitcoin scam loses home deposit
description: Teacher Julie Bushnell says she lost her deposit for a new home in a cryptocurrency giveaway con.

title: Champions League final moved to Porto and 12,000 Chelsea and Manchester City fans can attend
description: The Champions League final between Chelsea and Manchester City on 29 May is switched to Portugal from Turkey.

title: Premier League TV rights: Broadcasters agree to roll over existing deal
description: The Premier League agrees to roll over its existing television deal with broadcasters for a further three years.

title: Trains reintroduced after safety checks prompted by cracks
description: There has been disruption since Saturday after the issue was found on some Hitachi Class 800s.

title: The NHS Covid legacy - long waits and lives at risk
description: Nearly a third of hospitals sees long waits balloon, as NHS warned backlog will take years to tackle.

title: Crime drops by 8% during year of lockdowns, says ONS
description: A 26% fall in theft offences drove a reduction in crime recorded by police in England and Wales.

title: Julia James: Callum Wheeler in court over PCSO murder
description: Callum Wheeler, 21, from Aylesham, is accused of murdering community support officer Julia James.

title: Chrissy Teigen sorry for bullying Courtney Stodden on Twitter
description: TV personality Courtney Stodden accepts her apology but questions its sincerity.

title: Six Sale players in contention for South Africa squad to face Lions
description: As many as six of Sale's South African contingent could feature for the Springboks against the Lions this summer.

title: Boris Johnson's lawyers confident of cancelling court judgement
description: A county-court order against the PM for a debt of £535 was over a claim of defamation, it has emerged.

title: Universal credit fraud and error at new high
description: Figures from the Department for Work and Pensions show £8.4bn was lost in 2020-21.

title: Travel firms warned over summer holiday refunds
description: Companies will be breaking the law if they delay or refuse refunds, warns the competition watchdog.

title: 'I'm not getting any younger but I won't give up' - Dott on depression, narcolepsy & battling
description: Former world champion Graeme Dott on the "torture" of his 2006 success and his struggles with depression and narcolepsy as he vows to keep going.

title: 'When I was younger, I thought I had to try to do it all' - the cricketer combining cultural pressures with elite sport
description: Cricketer Naomi Dattani explains how professional contracts have helped her juggle cultural expectations with elite sport.

title: Israel-Gaza: Rockets hit Israel after militants killed
description: Palestinian militants fire a barrage of rockets after some of their commanders die in air strikes.

title: How viral pianist with dementia is helping others
description: When Paul Harvey's piano playing went viral, it inspired a donation of £1 million to charity.

title: The papers: Fears of 'all-out war' and concerns over variant
description: Pictures of destruction in Gaza and Israel feature on the front pages of several papers.

title: Eid: 'You can be Muslim and still enjoy playing football'
description: For young Muslim footballers like Omar and Rahma, it's vital that faith and football go together.
